notes.note: This work summarizes our long-term vision on enabling cost-aware computer engineering autotuning using methodology from physics, biology and other natural sciences
This work extends our previous article [$#cm_29db2248aba45e59_6f40bc99c4f7df58#$]
Related Collective Knowledge infrastructure and repository [$#cm_d76ac3bb9a3f744c_be42dc8eef7d2041#$]
Related Collective Mind infrastructure and repository [$#cm_d76ac3bb9a3f744c_bd5c924415bae775#$]

This work supports our initiative on open research and publication model where all experimental results and related material is continuously shared, validated and improved by the community [$#cm_29db2248aba45e59_40a4b58adfb594a8#$]. To set up an example, we continue sharing all benchmarks, datasets, tools, models and experimental results in Collective Mind repository (c-mind.org/repo) and in a new version: Collective Knowledge Repository (cknowledge.org/repo)

title: Collective Mind, Part II: Towards Performance- and Cost-Aware Software Engineering as a Natural Science
where: 18th International Workshop on Compilers for Parallel Computing (CPC'15), London, UK
